Letra: When my eyes wake up and I see that I continue to live with you Peru excited I thank heaven for giving me life with you Peru. You are very big and you will always be, but if we are all with you, Peru. On my chest I wear your colors and my love is with you Peru. We are your children and we will unite and we will surely triumph with you Peru. United the coast, united the mountain, united the jungle, with you Peru. United work, united sport, united the north, the center and the south. To triumph Peruans who are brothers, let victory be our great gratitude. I can give you my life and if I died I would have the joy of joining Peru on earth. I wish I could give you my life and when I die, join in the land with you Peru.

Harvesting my seas, sowing my lands, I want more to my country, my nation that, fighting, broke the chains of slavery. That is the land of the Inca that the sun illuminates because God sends it, and that is that God changed his name and put Peru in glory. The fishing wealth of my sovereign sea is treasured by its beaches, and in the brave sierra the perpetual snow is the flag of peace, the mountain in its veins will keep the oil, it will be oil of our tomorrow, and the mountain land gives us the steel and the bread. And it's called Peru, with P of homeland, the E of the example, the R of the rifle, the U of the union ... My name is Peru, it's that my race, my Peruvian race with the blood and the soul painted the colors of my pavilion. I also call myself Peru with P de Patria, the E of the example, the R of the rifle, the U of the union ... My name is Peru, because my race, my race is Peruvian with blood and the soul painted the colors of my pavilion. The day you forget me, my soul, I do not know if you will exist in my pain. Seeing me sadly abandoned, my life would make me start, my life would make me start. There are things that are received with resignation, there are blows that fate gives without compassion, but when a love is lost there is nothing to calm this pain, there is nothing to calm that pain. You were my whole being, my love, I gave it to you, the love I give you is the most beautiful woman. If the bonds that unite us will break, the existence of my being will end right now. If the bonds that unite us will break, the existence of my being will end right now.

This secret that you have with me no one will know, this secret will be hidden for an eternity, I assure you I will never say anything of what happened and do not worry, that all of ours is between you and me. This secret that you have with me no one will know, this secret will be hidden for an eternity, I assure you I will never say anything of what happened and do not worry, that all of ours is between you and me. No one will know that your chest, close to mine has throbbed, that we enjoyed moments of fascinating sweetness. I will never say that there were nights that I adored you with madness, nobody will know that in your arms drunk with love, I fell asleep.

You said goodbye and I lacked the courage to ask you not to leave. You said goodbye, and the echo of your voice forever accompanies me. I am guilty of everything that I am now suffering. I can not anymore, for not having your love I feel like I'm dying. I should have begged you and I could not, I wanted to call you and I held back my lament and my pain. I saw you leave in the night, since then a reproach hurts my heart.

When you have to leave I want you to know that I will be thinking of you all my days. You will live in my joy and my sadness, you will reign on the altar of my soul, when you leave you will leave your agonies in the house that without you was very sad. No one will take the place you had, because my love died when you left. No one will take the place you had, because my love died when you left. Every Sunday at twelve I will go out to the window to wait as before after the mass, and in the lonely corner I will see my soul waiting for your steps, looking for my arms and without your smile the sun will go away in the morning you will be crying the bells every Sunday at twelve after the mass. Every Sunday at twelve o'clock I will go out to the window to wait as before after the mass, and in the lonely corner I will see my soul waiting for your steps, looking for my arms and without your smile the sun will go away in the morning, the bells will mourn every Sunday at twelve o'clock, after the mass.

The day I die I want to be buried where they bury the men of this earth. If my inherte body does not find a place anymore, I want my ashes to go to the sea. In the summer alone, your body on the sea with the kiss of the waves will have to remember me. And with the crepuscular breeze, my ashes sailing randomly over your body have to be impregnated to make you caress ... My ashes are memories, of a love that is burned in a bonfire. As they burn my ashes, and in the sand bank ... even my steps will be.

Only I who loved and adored her, seeing her like that, also cried, as on the night she left.

This is my land so is my Peru. Race that the world wrote to the gray history of the empire of the sun Raised flames my bicolor flag. On the mountain and mountain coast, with peace, work and love. This is my land so is my Peru. The richness of its coast in the world without equal, and the generous sierra fructifies our bread. While the mountain awaits who is going to conquer it, the pride of my race is the history of Peru. And I want this tondero with flavor of gratitude to be heard from the four winds, in the north, center and south. This is my land so is my Peru. This is my land so is my Peru. With the sincere cajonear and the guitar in hand we tell the Peruvians that we are all brothers.
